info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 2:33AM CDT until August 10 at 5:45AM CDT by NWS Omaha/Valley NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Nebraska, including the following counties, Douglas and Sarpy.
* WHEN...Until 545 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 233 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Omaha, southwestern Council Bluffs, Bellevue, Papillion, Ralston, Gretna, Boys Town, Millard, Offutt AFB, La Vista, Walnut Creek Recreation Area, Prairie Queen Recreation Area, Chalco, Aksarben, Wehrspann Lake, South Omaha, Zorinsky Lake, Benson, Midtown and Old Market.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING
